name: circuit board pattern
description:
Creates random circuit board traces. The code is meh, but the effect turned out pretty cool.
Each traces checks the pixels in front of them as they travel if the alpha value is anything other than 0 they change direction by 45 degrees.

name: color cycler
description: Was messing around on the SO Javascript chat with @rlemon and @Shmiddty came up with some color cycling code.. well really just a modification of the cycling base code I always use.

name: colorful cloth ribbons
description:
Heavily inspired by the amazing work done by Dan Gries of Rectangle World @RectangleWorld. Using midpoint displacement and morphing between points, the sweeping lines make an awesome effect. 
edit thanks to @towc fork which sped up the drawing process.

Even made a super serious domain for it http://guihacker.com and yeah this totally could be done in 100% css but I love my canvas. Definitely looks better fullscreen

name: snap to nearest power of 2
description:
This is a little tip for those participating in #LOWREZJAM. In this jam you have to make a game based on a 32x32 playing field. However, you are allowed to scale up the display to make things easier to see, as long as the underlying rendering remains at 32x32. With that stipulation, it is in your best interest to scale your game only by powers of 2. The function in this pen will snap to the nearest power of 2 that fits within the window.
Forked from Jack Rugile's Pen Snap to Nearest Fitting Power of 2..

However, you are allowed to scale up the display to make things easier to see, as long as the underlying rendering remains at 32x32. With that stipulation, it is in your best interest to scale your game only by powers of 2. The function in this pen will snap to the nearest power of 2 that fits within the window.

If this wets your appetite for zombies check out my site http://zombiegames.net the best zombie game site on the net :P
